comment_text: AI Breakdown - We are witnessing a massive psychological shift in how Gen Z and Millennials approach wealth creation compared to Boomers and Gen X. The core driver? Desperation mixed with optimism. 73% of younger adults believe it is harder for their generation to build wealth by traditional means. Because they feel locked out of the "old playbook" (like home ownership and standard dividends), they are aggressively pivoting to new strategies. Key takeaways: Risk as a Necessity: Younger investors are nearly 3x as likely to trade weekly compared to older investors and are far more willing to use margin to increase upside potential. The Asset Flip: They report having 25% of their portfolios in non-traditional assets (crypto, DeFi, derivatives), which is triple the allocation of older investors. The Death of the Traditional Advisor: Only 33% of younger investors rely on financial planners, compared to 51% of older investors. Instead, they are turning to YouTube, friends, and "social trading" to make decisions. The takeaway is clear: The emerging investor isn't just looking for a digital version of the stock market‚Äîthey are looking for an "Everything Exchange" that offers 24/7 access to alternative assets to help them catch up.

comment_text: Really appreciate this perspective. One of the things that continues to stand out to me about Coinbase is the clarity and conviction behind its mission. It‚Äôs rare to see a company build its culture so intentionally around purpose, high ownership, and long-term thinking‚Äîespecially in an industry that moves as quickly as crypto. What resonates most is the idea that culture isn‚Äôt built on consensus, but on alignment around a mission that truly matters. That approach attracts people who want to do meaningful work and who believe in the broader impact crypto can have on economic freedom. It‚Äôs inspiring to see Coinbase lean into that philosophy instead of diluting it. The Harvard Business School deep-dive reinforces what many of us already see from the outside: Coinbase is building something different, and doing it in a principled, mission-driven way. Exciting to watch the company continue growing in the right direction.

comment_text: The interesting part here isn‚Äôt just ‚Äúborrowing without selling.‚Äù We‚Äôve seen that before. What‚Äôs new is how clean the experience is becoming when everything sits on the same stack‚Ä¶ BTC ‚Üí cbBTC on Base ‚Üí Morpho liquidity ‚Üí USDC in your account in seconds. This is the first real glimpse of what onchain personal finance could look like at scale. No fragmentation. No jumping between protocols. The user doesn‚Äôt even feel the infrastructure underneath. ETH-backed and staked ETH next is also a big step. Once collateral mobility becomes instant and programmable, the traditional idea of a loan starts to look outdated. Crypto credit is slowly turning into a real product category.
author_headline: Crypto & FinTech Marketing Strategist | Global Web3 & Institutional Advisor | Specializing in Stablecoin Regulation, RWA & ETF Market Structure | Leveraging AI for Global Growth

comment_text: One thing I keep thinking about is what happens when ETH moves 20 to 25% in a month, which it often does. If someone starts at 50% LTV and ETH drops about 24%, their LTV jumps to roughly 66%. Start nearer 70% and you are suddenly above 90%, which is where margin calls and forced selling usually kick in for normal users. Feels like the real value is pairing this with clear stress tests and guardrails. For example. ‚ÄúHere is what a 20 to 30% drawdown does to your LTV and when action is likely.‚Äù Are you seeing most people keep a big enough buffer, or do they still push close to the edge?
author_headline: Data & Operations Specialist | Turning Field Team Complexity into Simple, Scalable Processes | Member of TechUK & GM Chamber

comment_text: ETH-backed loans are an exciting step forward. Borrowing USDC against your Ethereum‚Äîwithout selling‚Äîshows how blockchain finance is starting to replace traditional lending models. This kind of on-chain collateral lending could easily become a big part of our financial future. But there‚Äôs another side to the story. As crypto-based borrowing expands and cash slowly disappears, every transaction becomes fully transparent and traceable. While that transparency is great for security and compliance, it can also create problems. People who rely on cash or value financial privacy could be negatively affected. Lower-income groups, who may already struggle with digital access or documentation, risk being pushed further to the margins in a system where every movement of money is monitored. So yes‚ÄîETH-backed loans are innovation in motion. But as we move toward a world of tokenized lending and the decline of cash, we need to make sure this evolution doesn‚Äôt come at the expense of those with the least financial flexibility.
author_headline: QA Specialist | Bilingual (Hungarian/English) | Content & Trust Safety | Digital Marketing QA | Web & Content Support

comment_text: Coinbase continues to roll out some amazing products in the crypto space. You can now use Bitcoin as collateral for a loan, and I have personally taken a loan against my own Bitcoin. And Coinbase is not stopping there. The MONAD token sale is another strong move. Keep up the great work, Coinbase.

comment_text: üö® Dear Coinbase ‚Äî Your partnership affects real people in India, and we need your support. üö® I truly appreciate Coinbase‚Äôs commitment to global user protection. But as a major investor and ecosystem partner of CoinDCX, I request your urgent attention. Many retail investors ‚Äî including myself ‚Äî are facing avoidable financial losses on CoinDCX due to: ‚Ä¢ Wrong execution of Take-Profit orders ‚Ä¢ App glitches causing forced losses ‚Ä¢ Sudden delistings with <24 hrs notice ‚Ä¢ No forensic audit even after 2 months ‚Ä¢ Copy-paste responses to serious complaints These are not market risks ‚Äî üëâ They are platform risks harming users. Indian investors trusted CoinDCX because of Coinbase‚Äôs credibility. Now, we request your leadership to: ‚úÖ Review CoinDCX‚Äôs operational standards ‚úÖ Ensure accountability and user protection in India ‚úÖ Support fair resolution for affected users A respected brand like Coinbase Brian Armstrong should not allow its network partners to damage investor trust. comment_text: I have been in a horrendous lawsuit for the last 2 years. We won a multi-million dollar judgement against the defendant; a man that caused irreparable damage to my company and my family; through defamation, business disparagement and malicious breach of contract. In anticipation of our collections efforts, he moved everything to crypto. Every other crypto platform rejected this man, but Coinbase welcomes him with open arms. We submitted a subpoena to Coinbase on September 7th, so we could verify his accounts. There has been no response, whatsoever. There is no legal contact to follow-up with, no available support and even the form to submit for customer complaints does not work. It appears to our legal team that Coinbase is aiding and abetting a known conman and professional scam artist. This man has amassed significant wealth by scamming people out of their hard-earned money and now it all sits on the Coinbase exchange, where this conman knows he will be protected from law enforcement and the the judicial system. https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cabo-platinum-secures-30-million-140000230.html Dana Wagner David Gondo Paul Grewal Anagh Tiwari Molly Abraham Yuliya Prokopyshyn Katie Fry-Paul

comment_text: On 11 October, I lost a dear friend to suicide ‚Äî a tragedy tied to the actions and failures of Bybit (Account No. 48298347) and its leadership, including Ben Zhou and Bybit. The blood of this loss is on their hands. My friend was a loyal Bybit user for years. His portfolio included SUI, FIL, and LTC in his spot account, along with USDT in a unified trading account ‚Äî his entire life savings. His dream was simple and dignified: to sell these holdings during the next bull run and buy a family home. That Friday night, Bybit forcibly liquidated his account despite sufficient funds. He desperately tried to access the app to add margin and save his holdings, but the system failed, locking him out. Within moments, everything he had worked for was gone. The shock and despair were unbearable, and he ended his life shortly after. His wife is now fighting for justice, filing complaints with the CFTC and SFIO, calling for a full investigation into Bybit‚Äôs practices and the accountability of its leadership. This is not just a financial failure ‚Äî it is an ethical collapse. When a platform‚Äôs greed and negligence destroy lives, they must face consequences.
author_headline: CEO at Lunaphone Inc. (skype: live:lunaphone )

comment_text: Brian Armstrong You might be interested in an issue I‚Äôve been trying for weeks to resolve with your support team‚Äîone that‚Äôs currently holding nearly $200,000 on your platform. My Coinbase account allows both the advanced and older standard UIs. In the standard UI, your system let me purchase Pepenode (which apparently isn‚Äôt officially supported). Coinbase took fees from those transactions and shows the tokens as being held in my Coinbase account as custodian. (Screenshots and transaction history have been provided to Support as proof.) comment_text: I have been in a horrendous lawsuit for the last 2 years. We won a multi-million dollar judgement against the defendant; a man that caused irreparable damage to my company and my family; through defamation, business disparagement and malicious breach of contract. In anticipation of our collections efforts, he moved everything to crypto. Every other crypto platform rejected this man, but Coinbase welcomes him with open arms. We submitted a subpoena to Coinbase on September 7th, so we could verify his accounts. There has been no response, whatsoever. There is no legal contact to follow-up with, no available support and even the form to submit for customer complaints does not work. It appears to our legal team that Coinbase is aiding and abetting a known conman and professional scam artist. This man has amassed significant wealth by scamming people out of their hard-earned money and now it all sits on the Coinbase exchange, where this conman knows he will be protected from law enforcement and the the judicial system. https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cabo-platinum-secures-30-million-140000230.html Dana Wagner David Gondo Paul Grewal Anagh Tiwari Molly Abraham Yuliya Prokopyshyn Katie Fry-Paul

We submitted a subpoena to Coinbase on September 7th, so we could verify his accounts. There has been no response, whatsoever. There is no legal contact to follow-up with, no available support and even the form to submit for customer complaints does not work. It appears to our legal team that Coinbase is aiding and abetting a known conman and professional scam artist. This man has amassed significant wealth by scamming people out of their hard-earned money and now it all sits on the Coinbase exchange, where this conman knows he will be protected from law enforcement and the the judicial system. https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cabo-platinum-secures-30-million-140000230.html Dana Wagner David Gondo Paul Grewal Anagh Tiwari Molly Abraham Yuliya Prokopyshyn Katie Fry-Paul

comment_text: ‚ö†Ô∏è My Real Experience as a Retail Investor ‚Äî A Call for Accountability I‚Äôm an Indian retail investor who trusted @CoinDCX ‚Äî a platform that presents itself as a @Coinbase partner. Unfortunately, my experience has been deeply disappointing. I have suffered losses of over ‚Çπ2,00,000 due to: Technical glitches and wrong order executions Sudden delistings with less than 24 hours‚Äô notice Lack of response and transparency from customer support Deletion of genuine investor comments on LinkedIn Despite continuous follow-ups since August 2025, there‚Äôs been no resolution or compensation. Instead of addressing issues, the company continues to silence users who share their real stories. I urge @Coinbase to review its partnership with CoinDCX and take note of how Indian investors are being treated. Investor protection and transparency should never be compromised. comment_text: 100% agree with "Read, Write, and Own." And if we double click on "Tokenization," it becomes even more powerful. It is not only about owning our identity or earning from our contributions. It also introduces real accountability. The internet may feel like a human right, but we cannot forget it is still a privilege, and ownership means stepping up to that responsibility. As we enter this next era, aligning incentives should also inspire higher standards for how we show up online and leave less room for harmful behavior from those who hide behind anonymity. comment_text: I have been in a horrendous lawsuit for the last 2 years. We won a multi-million dollar judgement against the defendant; a man that caused irreparable damage to my company and my family; through defamation, business disparagement and malicious breach of contract. In anticipation of our collections efforts, he moved everything to crypto. Every other crypto platform rejected this man, but Coinbase welcomes him with open arms. We submitted a subpoena to Coinbase on September 7th, so we could verify his accounts. There has been no response, whatsoever. There is no legal contact to follow-up with, no available support and even the form to submit for customer complaints does not work. It appears to our legal team that Coinbase is aiding and abetting a known conman and professional scam artist. This man has amassed significant wealth by scamming people out of their hard-earned money and now it all sits on the Coinbase exchange, where this conman knows he will be protected from law enforcement and the the judicial system. https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cabo-platinum-secures-30-million-140000230.html Dana Wagner David Gondo Paul Grewal Anagh Tiwari Molly Abraham Yuliya Prokopyshyn Katie Fry-Paul

comment_text: Why don‚Äôt Nasdaq, NYSE, or OTC hold customer funds? Because custody and trading are separate by design. The SEC learned long ago: if one entity controls both your money and your trades, the risks are enormous‚Äîconflicts of interest, hacks, systemic failure. Coinbase is both custodian + exchange. That‚Äôs efficient, but dangerous. A $400M hack proved the vulnerability: one breach could drain wallets and manipulate trading at scale. This is exactly why Wall Street will never allow exchanges to hold customer assets. Separation = protection.

comment_text: ‚ö†Ô∏è My Real Experience as a Retail Investor ‚Äî A Call for Accountability I‚Äôm an Indian retail investor who trusted @CoinDCX ‚Äî a platform that presents itself as a @Coinbase partner. Unfortunately, my experience has been deeply disappointing. I have suffered losses of over ‚Çπ2,00,000 due to: Technical glitches and wrong order executions Sudden delistings with less than 24 hours‚Äô notice Lack of response and transparency from customer support Deletion of genuine investor comments on LinkedIn Despite continuous follow-ups since August 2025, there‚Äôs been no resolution or compensation. Instead of addressing issues, the company continues to silence users who share their real stories. I urge @Coinbase to review its partnership with CoinDCX and take note of how Indian investors are being treated. Investor protection and transparency should never be compromised. Traditionally,the market recognizes three categories of stablecoins: Fiat-backed(e.g.,USD...),Commodity-backed (e.g., gold), Algorithmic.What we‚Äôre building is fundamentally different a stablecoin backed by the GDP performance of countries.This approach introduces a new benchmark for fairness,resilience,& economic representation,especially for cross-border and inflation-hedged use cases. As attached chart, since 10Jan25, the index backing our model has moved by only -2.3% while the U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) has declined-6.9 over the same period. comment_text: I have been in a horrendous lawsuit for the last 2 years. We won a multi-million dollar judgement against the defendant; a man that caused irreparable damage to my company and my family; through defamation, business disparagement and malicious breach of contract. In anticipation of our collections efforts, he moved everything to crypto. Every other crypto platform rejected this man, but Coinbase welcomes him with open arms. We submitted a subpoena to Coinbase on September 7th, so we could verify his accounts. There has been no response, whatsoever. There is no legal contact to follow-up with, no available support and even the form to submit for customer complaints does not work. It appears to our legal team that Coinbase is aiding and abetting a known conman and professional scam artist. This man has amassed significant wealth by scamming people out of their hard-earned money and now it all sits on the Coinbase exchange, where this conman knows he will be protected from law enforcement and the the judicial system. https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cabo-platinum-secures-30-million-140000230.html Dana Wagner David Gondo Paul Grewal Anagh Tiwari Molly Abraham Yuliya Prokopyshyn Katie Fry-Paul

comment_text: Candidates using AI to tailor resumes to the job description. Firms using AI to find high correlation between the tailored resumes and job descriptions. It seems so circular and likely wasted time and effort on both sides. Similar to credit scores, what CAN be manipulated WILL be manipulated. What is truly predictive are attributes no easily manipulated. So that goes for puffery in LinkedIn profiles, LinkedIn ‚Äúconnections‚Äù who don‚Äôt even know each other well enough for a recommendation to have meaning or maybe don‚Äôt know each other at all, and resumes that can say anything without any verification that it is true. What will always work are personal recommendations from those in your network you trust, face to face conversations, live case studies, and probationary periods for new hires.

comment_text: As someone who‚Äôs led AI-powered HR transformations and advised on workforce strategy during M&A integrations, it's energizing to see Coinbase‚Äôs forward-thinking use of AI in recruiting. Piloting AI agents for phone screens isn‚Äôt just operational efficiency: it‚Äôs a signal that recruiting can become more intelligent, more human-centric, and less biased when done right. In my work, I‚Äôve seen how AI-driven decision tools can cut decision latency by 20% and reduce attrition through targeted, data-informed interventions. But tools are only part of the story. Success lies in how they‚Äôre embedded into change-ready cultures. Kudos to you and the team, L.J., for putting this vision into motion. I‚Äôll be watching closely, and cheering you and your team on!

comment_text: Hi L.J. Brock, While I support the use of AI in recruiting, there's a risk of missing strong candidates whose experience doesn‚Äôt exactly match job descriptions. comment_text: L.J. Brock the biggest hole I see in this approach is in defining terms. Too often, I read a posting that uses undefined jargon or language specific to the hiring company that doesn‚Äôt translate across sectors. Applicants are left guessing whether their qualifications match and struggle to tailor their resumes and cover letters to the posting. It often seems that these postings are written by HR professionals without review by the appropriate teams who would ultimately work with the candidate. Then, those same HR professionals are the ones doing the initial screening and often miss candidates who meet or exceed qualifications based on experience that translates well to the position but doesn‚Äôt translate well on paper because of poorly defined terms. I see this problem worsening with AI unless there is constsistent and continual involvement by non-HR and tech members of the company. Bias exists in AI, but it can shrink so long as the pool of influence on its creation and expansion grows.

This is super exciting to see! During my time at Cognizant, I worked closely on Conversational AI Bot ü§ñ and saw firsthand how smart automation can enhance both user experience and decision-making. Integrating AI into the recruitment journey , especially for initial screening feels like a game changer in terms of scalability and consistency. üòÉ ü§ñ

comment_text: In any transformational change in HR, the end goal should be to add value to the roles of those doing the work while positively impacting both the employee experience and the bottom line. It‚Äôs inspiring to see Coinbase leading the way in responsibly integrating AI into the talent acquisition process. Rather than replacing the human touch, this approach enhances it‚Äîfreeing recruiters to focus on meaningful engagement while giving candidates more equitable and timely opportunities to shine. The future of recruiting is here, and it‚Äôs both smart and human. Bravo to the team for building with intention and transparency.

We submitted a subpoena to Coinbase on September 7th, so we could verify his accounts. There has been no response, whatsoever. There is no legal contact to follow-up with, no available support and even the form to submit for customer complaints does not work. It appears to our legal team that Coinbase is aiding and abetting a known conman and professional scam artist. comment_text: I bought MY coin, Dex from Coinbase and they disappeared from my Coinbase balance and Coinbase team said "Since this transfer was made to an external address that is not registered in your Coinbase app, the MetaYield (MY) token balance no longer appears in your Coinbase account." Coinbase's FALSE CLAIMS VS. DOCUMENTED FACTS: Coinbase Claim: I transferred MY tokens to my "Web3 wallet" FACT: I have never registered for, created, or connected any Web3 or decentralized wallet to my Coinbase account. I have screenshots and account records proving this. Coinbase Claim: This was an authorized transaction FACT: I had two-factor authentication enabled and never received any notification about this transfer. The transaction occurred without my knowledge or consent. Coinbase Claim: The transaction went to an "external address not registered in your Coinbase app" FACT: If it's not registered in my account, how exactly did YOU allow the transfer? This proves YOUR security failure, not my authorization. Coinbase is violating Bank Secrecy Act: Failure to maintain required transaction records Federal Evidence Tampering Laws: Destroying transaction records during a dispute Consumer Protection Laws: False statements and victim blaming

The Boomer Exodus: Crypto, Trump, and Common Sense The fading power of baby boomers ushers in a new era, potentially reshaped by cryptocurrency and Donald Trump's pragmatic leadership. Boomers leave a mixed legacy of debt and outdated systems. Cryptocurrency offers financial freedom, sidestepping traditional constraints. Trump's return could mean deregulation and innovation, resonating with those seeking results over bureaucracy. This shift promises a landscape where startups and blockchain thrive, potentially revitalizing America. However, we must learn from past activism to avoid over-correction. The blend of crypto's decentralization and Trump's straightforward approach might spark a new American renaissance, where opportunity blooms and corruption diminishes. By Tommy 'Turbo Money'

comment_text: I have been in a horrendous lawsuit for the last 2 years. We won a multi-million dollar judgement against the defendant; a man that caused irreparable damage to my company and my family; through defamation, business disparagement and malicious breach of contract. In anticipation of our collections efforts, he moved everything to crypto. Every other crypto platform rejected this man, but Coinbase welcomes him with open arms. We submitted a subpoena to Coinbase on September 7th, so we could verify his accounts. There has been no response, whatsoever. There is no legal contact to follow-up with, no available support and even the form to submit for customer complaints does not work. It appears to our legal team that Coinbase is aiding and abetting a known conman and professional scam artist. This man has amassed significant wealth by scamming people out of their hard-earned money and now it all sits on the Coinbase exchange, where this conman knows he will be protected from law enforcement and the the judicial system. https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cabo-platinum-secures-30-million-140000230.html Dana Wagner David Gondo Paul Grewal Anagh Tiwari Molly Abraham Yuliya Prokopyshyn Katie Fry-Paul

comment_text: International investors and regulators must take note: CoinDCX, under the leadership of Sumit Gupta and, Neeraj Khandelwal caused massive financial losses to Indian retail investors through technical failures, sudden delistings, and a complete lack of accountability. What‚Äôs truly disappointing is that global brands like Coinbase continue to be associated with such a platform despite these repeated investor complaints. This situation demands urgent global scrutiny, independent audit, and regulatory action. Transparency and ethics are not optional in finance ‚Äî they are fundamental. #InvestorRights #TransparencyMatters #JusticeForTraders #BoycottCoinDCX #CryptoIndia
